overview_of_class: The main emphasis in this course is on how sociological theory informs social research. We will read selections of classical social theory and then look at how various scholars have used that theory to help them analyze some aspect of society. We will keep moving between theoretical statements and applications or refinements of that theory. The course will be a mix of lectures and discussion.
name: Sociological Theory
title: WCAS SOCIOL 306-0-20 Sociological Theory
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-registration is reserved for Sociology Majors and Minors.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The main emphasis in this course is on how sociological theory informs social research. We will read selections of classical social theory and then look at how various scholars have used that theory to help them analyze some aspect of society. We will keep moving between theoretical statements and applications or refinements of that theory. The course will be a mix of lectures and discussion.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
During preregistration this course is only open to Sociology Majors & Minors.
This course is open to all students during regular registration.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: My goal for this class is to help students become familiar with important theoretical traditions in sociology and to improve their critical reading, thinking and writing. I want them to come away with new tools for understanding their own lives and the lives of people unlike them.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Some readings will be available on Canvas. Please contact the instructor for a list of books.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: First-years are discouraged from taking this class.
